definition-item.definition-title: EMBROIDERING; TUFTING (making non-woven fabrics D04H; sewing D05B)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The embroidering and tufting machines, the embroidered or tufted products, and the base fabrics and inserts.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of garments or of their making

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Embroidering and tufting
Sewing

section-body.paragraph-text: The classification in D05C is desirably complemented by a classification in the indexing scheme relating to sewing, embroidering and tufting D05D:

list-item.paragraph-text: selection of machines, accessories or parts of the same kind D05D2203/00;
interface between the operator and the machine D05D2205/00;
operations on the work before or after sewing D05D2305/00.

section-body.paragraph-text: Disclosures of general nature which are both applicable to D05B and D05C are preferably classified in D05B if the classification for the subject-matter concerned is more detailed (e.g. D05B85/00).
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Embroidering
is forming decorative designs with hand or machine needleworks
Tufting
is projecting yarns drawn through a fabric or making up a fabric so as to produce a surface of raised loops or cut pile

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus, devices, or tools for hand embroidering

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Decorating textiles by transferring fibres to the textile

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tools, implements, accessories, processes, apparatuses etc. for hand sewing

definition-item.definition-title: Work frames

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hoops or frames for hand sewing

definition-item.definition-title: {Holders for needles or threads}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Holders
are means for supporting, storing and organizing needles and threads.

definition-item.definition-title: General types of embroidering machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Multi-needles and multi-head embroidery machines.

definition-item.definition-title: Embroidering machines with arrangements for automatic control of a series of individual steps

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
All kinds of embroidery machines with arrangements for automatic control of a series of individual steps.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Programme-controlled sewing machines (with embroidering capability)
Sewing machines with devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier relative to stitch-forming mechanism in order to obtain particular configuration of seam

definition-item.definition-title: Special-purpose or automatic embroidering machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The embroidering machines where specific applications, e.g. for attaching decorative elements or for boring, can be carried out.

definition-item.definition-title: for boring or jogging

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Boring
is making a hole in the product
Jogging
is giving a slight push to a product in order to deform the product surface (e.g. embossing)

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: for embroidering festoons

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Festoons
are decorative chains or strips hanging between two points.

section-body.paragraph-text: In patent documents the following expression "scalloping machine" is often used.

definition-item.definition-title: for attaching cords, tapes, bands, or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines for attaching cords, tapes, bands and sequins.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Work-feeding or -handling elements for attaching bands, ribbons, strips, or tapes or for binding in a sewing machine

section-body.paragraph-text: The classification is desirably complemented with the Indexing Codes D05D2303/00 for identifying the applied objects or articles.

definition-item.definition-title: for separating and burning-off parts of the base fabric (making patterns or designs on fabrics by singeing or etching D06C23/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Producing embroidered textiles by chemical means and transferring embroidered products to textiles

definition-item.definition-title: Appliances for holding or feeding the base fabric in embroidering machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Work holders or carriers, feeding arrangements, and systems for holding, stretching, suspending and balancing therefor.

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for guiding, feeding, handling, or treating the threads in embroidering machines; Machine needles; Operating or control mechanisms therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices acting directly or indirectly on the thread material used for embroidery.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Guides for filamentary materials
Moistening, sizing, oiling, waxing, colouring or drying filamentary material as additional measures during package formation
Sewing machine elements for supplying, handling or treating thread material
Needles for sewing

definition-item.definition-title: Machine needles

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Needles for sewing

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for fastening or inserting in bars or carriers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for fastening needles to needle bars in sewing
Devices for inserting needles

section-body.paragraph-text: The classification is desirably complemented with the Indexing Codes D05D2203/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Thread-tensioning arrangements {(inside the shuttle D05C11/18)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Thread-tensioning arrangements in embroidering machines.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Thread-tensioning arrangements incorporated inside the shuttle

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Adjusting or controlling tension in filamentary material, e.g. for preventing snarling, application of tension indicators
Needle-thread tensioning devices in sewing

definition-item.definition-title: Stop motions responsive to thread tension or breakage

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Warning or safety devices, e.g. stop-motions, responsive to reduction in material tension, failure of supply, or breakage of material

definition-item.definition-title: Shuttles {; Shuttle holders; Shuttle driving arrangements}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Shuttles, shuttle holders, shuttle driving arrangements, and systems for the preparation of the thread and the bobbin.

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for cutting the needle or lower threads

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shearing embroidery, e.g. cutting loose threads
Removing floats

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for severing the needle or lower thread in sewing

definition-item.definition-title: incorporating devices for dyeing or impregnating the threads

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tufting by inserting loops of different colour

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Printing on textile
Moistening, sizing, oiling, waxing, colouring or drying filamentary material as additional measures during package formation
Devices incorporated in sewing machines for lubricating, waxing, or colouring the threads
Partial dyeing of textile materials
Dyeing or printing textiles

definition-item.definition-title: Auxiliary devices incorporated in embroidering machines, not otherwise provided for; Ancillary apparatus for use with embroidering machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Auxiliary devices incorporated in embroidering machines, not otherwise provided for, and ancillary apparatus for use with embroidering machines e.g. apparatuses for framing fabric in embroidery hoops, shuttle inserters, holding devices, apparatuses for needle threading, apparatuses for projecting sample designs.

definition-item.definition-title: Counting, measuring, indicating, warning, or safety devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applications of devices for metering predetermined lengths of running material
Applications of measuring devices for determining the length of threads used in sewing machines

definition-item.definition-title: Lubricating devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubricating or cooling devices in sewing machines

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus for filling or threading shuttles

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Needle or looper threading devices in sewing

definition-item.definition-title: Making pile fabrics or articles having similar surface features by inserting loops into a base material (layered products B32B; non-woven pile fabrics D04H11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines and methods for insertion of loops, which can be cut, into a base material.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Layered products forming non-woven pile fabrics
Woven pile fabrics
Pile-fabric looms
Non-woven pile fabrics

definition-item.definition-title: Tufting

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tufting
is forming projections of yarns drawn through a fabric so as to produce a surface of raised loops or cut pile

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements or devices for manipulating threads (D05C15/26 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Arrangements or devices for manipulating threads, e.g. yarn adjusters to control length in proximity of the needle.

definition-item.definition-title: Thread feeding or tensioning arrangements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Thread feeding or tensioning arrangements, e.g. control of thread feeding.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Forwarding filamentary material
Adjusting or controlling tension in filamentary material, e.g. for preventing snarling, application of tension indicators

definition-item.definition-title: by moving the tufting tools laterally

section-body.paragraph-text: The classification is desirably complemented with the Indexing Codes D05D2207/00 for identifying the use of special elements, i.e. pneumatic, hydraulic or magnetic devices.

definition-item.definition-title: Embroidered or tufted products; Base fabrics specially adapted for embroidered work; Inserts for producing surface irregularities in embroidered products (layered products B32B; non-woven pile fabrics D04H11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Products obtained by means of machines and methods of D05C1/00 - D05C15/00, the base fabrics and the inserts adapted for embroidered work.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wearing apparel

definition-item.definition-title: Tufted products

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Artificial grass
Floor fabrics
Non-slip mats for baths
Mats or gratings combined with brushes
Mats or the like for absorbing shocks for jumping, gymnastics or the like
Mats or carpets for courts
Flocking
Producing floor coverings from plastics
Layered products
Vehicle passenger accommodation not otherwise provided for
Fabrics, e.g. felts, non-woven fabrics, cotton-wool, wadding
Wall, floor or like covering materials
Pavings or foundations specially adapted for playgrounds or sports grounds
Flexible ohmic-resistance heating, e.g. heating nets or webs
Floors or floor coverings specially adapted for discharging static charges
